etymologies: Old English scrapian ‘scratch with the fingernails’, of Germanic origin, reinforced in Middle English by Old Norse skrapa or Middle Dutch schrapen ‘to scratch’

definitions: push or pull a hard or sharp implement across (a surface or object) so as to remove dirt or other matter

examples.text: we scraped the dishes clean
rinse off the carrots and scrape them

shortDefinitions: drag or pull hard or sharp implement across surface

definitions: use a sharp or hard implement to remove (dirt or unwanted matter) from something

examples.text: she scraped the mud off her shoes

shortDefinitions: use sharp or hard implement to remove dirt or unwanted matter from something

definitions: apply (a hard or sharp implement) to a surface so as to remove dirt or other matter

examples.text: he scraped the razor across the stubble on his cheek

shortDefinitions: apply hard or sharp implement to surface so as to remove dirt or other matter

definitions: make (a hollow) by scraping away soil or rock

examples.text: he found a ditch, scraped a hole, and put the bag in it

shortDefinitions: make hollow by scraping away soil or rock

definitions: rub or cause to rub by accident against a rough or hard surface, causing damage or injury

examples.text: he smashed into the wall and felt his knee scrape against the plaster
she reversed in a reckless sweep, scraping the left front fender

shortDefinitions: rub or cause to rub by accident against rough or hard surface

definitions: draw or move (something) along or over something else, making a harsh noise

examples.text: she scraped back her chair and stood up

shortDefinitions: draw or move something along or over something else, making harsh noise

definitions: move with or make a harsh scraping sound

examples.text: she lifted the gate to prevent its scraping along the ground

shortDefinitions: move with or make harsh scraping sound

definitions: play a violin or similar stringed instrument tunelessly

examples.text: Katie was scraping away at her cello

shortDefinitions: play violin tunelessly

definitions: draw one's hair tightly back off the forehead

examples.text: her hair was scraped back into a ponytail

shortDefinitions: draw one's hair tightly back off forehead

definitions: narrowly pass by or through something

examples.text: there was only just room to scrape through between the tree and the edge of the stream

shortDefinitions: narrowly pass by or through something

definitions: barely manage to succeed in a particular undertaking

examples.text: he scraped through the entrance exam
Clinton scraped into office in 1992

shortDefinitions: barely manage to succeed in particular undertaking

definitions: just manage to achieve; accomplish with great effort or difficulty

examples.text: for some years he scraped a living as a tutor

shortDefinitions: just manage to achieve

definitions: collect or accumulate something with difficulty

examples.text: they could hardly scrape up enough money for one ticket, let alone two

shortDefinitions: collect or accumulate something with difficulty

definitions: try to save as much money as possible; economize

examples.text: they had scrimped and scraped and saved for years

shortDefinitions: try to save as much money as possible

definitions: manage to live with difficulty

examples.text: she has to scrape by on Social Security

shortDefinitions: manage to live with difficulty

synonyms.text: barely have enough to live on
scarcely have enough to live on
keep the wolf from the door

definitions: copy (data) from a website using a computer program

examples.text: all search engines scrape content from sites without permission and display it on their own sites

shortDefinitions: copy data from website using computer program

phrases.text: scrape the bottom of the barrel

definitions: an act or sound of scraping

examples.text: he heard the scrape of his mother's key in the lock

shortDefinitions: act or sound of scraping

definitions: an injury or mark caused by scraping

examples.text: there was a long, shallow scrape on his shin

shortDefinitions: injury or mark caused by scraping

definitions: a place where soil has been scraped away, especially a shallow hollow formed in the ground by a bird during a courtship display or for nesting

examples.text: ringed plovers incubate eggs in shallow scrapes

shortDefinitions: place where soil has been scraped away

definitions: an obsequious bow in which one foot is drawn backward along the ground.
shortDefinitions: obsequious bow in which one foot is drawn backwards along ground

definitions: a procedure of dilatation of the cervix and curettage of the uterus.
shortDefinitions: procedure of dilatation of cervix and curettage of uterus

definitions: an embarrassing or difficult predicament caused by one's own unwise behavior

examples.text: he'd been in worse scrapes than this before now

shortDefinitions: embarrassing or difficult predicament caused by one's own unwise behaviour

phrases.text: scrape the bottom of the barrel
